p: Administration of TQ (20 and 40 mg/kg, i.p.) and codeine (5 mg/kg), as a prototype antitussive agent, reduced the amount of cough in guinea pigs exposed to citric acid 20%. The antitussive effect of TQ was antagonized by pretreatment with an opioid receptor antagonist (naloxone, 2 mg/kg) [ 123].
